oai_dc:dc.dc:title: XUV lasing during strong-field assisted transient absorption in molecules
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bredtmann, Timm
Chelkowski, Szczepan
Bandrauk, Andre. D.
Ivanov, Misha
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Atomic Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Using ab-initio non-Born-Oppenheimer simulations, we demonstrate amplification of XUV radiation in a high-harmonic generation type process using the example of the hydrogen molecular ion. A small fraction of the molecules is pumped to a dissociative Rydberg state from which IR-assisted XUV amplification is observed. We show that starting at sufficiently high IR driving field intensities the ground state molecules become quasi-transparent for XUV radiation, while due to stabilization gain from Rydberg states is maintained, thus leading to lasing from strongly driven Rydberg states. Further increase of the IR intensity even leads to gain by initially unexcited molecules, which are quickly excited by the driving IR pulse.
